definition: lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself

sentences.english: The philistine is often a snob.
I believe he seriously thinks me an Philistine.
sentences.chinese: 我相信，他真的认为我是个不可救药的庸人。

sentences.english: In fact, most people don't complain frivolously.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，很少人会“庸人自扰”。

sentences.english: Mean men admire wealth; great men, glory.
sentences.chinese: 庸人爱财富，伟人爱荣誉。

sentences.english: It was much ado about nothing.
The opportunity to progress for people to open, mediocre never patronize.
sentences.chinese: 机会只对进取有为的人开放，庸人永远无法光顾。

sentences.english: As for the wave is mediocre, and hard work is wise move.
sentences.chinese: 碌碌无为是庸人所为，奋发图强是智者之举。

sentences.english: I would tell myself not to think of it any more.
sentences.chinese: 我会告诉自己，不要再庸人自扰了。

sentences.english: Don't make much ado about nothing.
sentences.chinese: 意思是说庸人多自忧，不要小题大作。

sentences.english: Mediocrities bother to spend her time will be, homo habilis had shrewd use of our time.
sentences.chinese: 庸人费心将是消磨时光，能人费尽心计利用时间。

sentences.english: She fusses too much about her health.
sentences.chinese: 她对她的健康有点庸人自扰。

definition: to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
